prompt: <description>**Instructions for Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are rounded, and the sides are straight. The object is centered in the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Proceed to create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 contains one loop (loop\\_1) that has four curves: * line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.5556, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point = [0.5556, 0.0], End Point = [0.4702, 0.5837] * arc\\_1: Start Point = [0.4702, 0.5837], Mid Point = [0.2778, 0.75], End Point = [0.0854, 0.5837] * line\\_3: Start Point = [0.0854, 0.5837], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Loop\\_1 is a closed loop that consists of lines and arcs only, as per the rules provided. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.0833 units. **Instructions for Part 2** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The object has a series of concentric circles that create a stepped appearance. The top and bottom sections are flat and parallel to each other. The middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom sections. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and the translation vector to 0.1889, 0.4667, 0.0833. Proceed to create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 contains one loop (loop\\_1) that has one curve: * circle\\_1: Center = [0.0889, 0.0889], Radius = 0.0889 Loop\\_1 is a closed loop that consists of circles only, as per the rules provided. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.1778. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.0278 units. Perform a boolean join operation with the previous body. **Instructions for Part 3** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top and bottom edges are curved and the bottom edge is straight. The prism is centered on the white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 and the translation vector to 0.1889, 0.6444, 0.0. Proceed to create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 contains one loop (loop\\_1) that has one curve: * circle\\_1: Center = [0.0889, 0.0889], Radius = 0.0889 Loop\\_1 is a closed loop that consists of circles only, as per the rules provided. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.1778. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base of the Prism Construct the base of the prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0675, 0.0] Now, create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following loop: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.0675, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.0675, 0.0], ending at [0.0675, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.0675, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.0] This sketch represents a 2D rectangle that needs to be scaled by 0.75x and then extruded with the following properties: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0675 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2: Creating the Curved Surface on One Side Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0225, 0.0, 0.6825] Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system and construct the following: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.0225, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.0225, 0.0], ending at [0.0225, 0.0675] * Line 3: Starting at [0.0225, 0.0675], ending at [0.0, 0.0675] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0675], ending at [0.0, 0.0] The sketch should be scaled by 0.0675x and the resulting shape needs to be subtracted from the existing body. The extrusion parameters should be: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.141 * Operation: Cut feature operation Part 3: Cutting a Notch Construct a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0225, 0.0675, 0.3412] Sketch a rectangle on the XY plane, similar to the previous steps. Scale the sketch by 0.0675x and cut this shape out of the existing body with the following extrusion parameters: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.0338 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Operation: Subtract the sketch from the existing body</description>
